verses.kjv: And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, he gathered of the house of Judah and Benjamin an hundred and fourscore thousand chosen men, which were warriors, to fight against Israel, that he might bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam.
verses.web: When Rehoboam had come to Jerusalem, he assembled the house of Judah and Benjamin, one hundred eighty thousand chosen men who were warriors, to fight against Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam.
verses.ct: When Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he assembled 180,000 elite warriors from the tribes of Judah and Benjamin to fight against Israel and reclaim the kingdom for himself.

verses.kjv: But the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
verses.web: But LORD’s word came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
verses.ct: But the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, a man of God:

verses.kjv: Speak unto Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying,
verses.web: “Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying,
verses.ct: "Go tell King Rehoboam son of Solomon, and all the Israelites living in Judah and Benjamin:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren: return every man to his house: for this thing is done of me. And they obeyed the words of the LORD, and returned from going against Jeroboam.
verses.web: ‘LORD says, “You shall not go up, nor fight against your brothers! Every man return to his house; for this thing is of me.” ’ ” So they listened to LORD’s words, and returned from going against Jeroboam.
verses.ct: 'This is what the LORD says: Do not march out to fight against your own brothers. Every man go home, because I am the one who made this happen.'" So they obeyed the LORD's message and turned back from attacking Jeroboam.

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem, and built cities for defence in Judah.
verses.web: Rehoboam lived in Jerusalem, and built cities for defense in Judah.
verses.ct: Rehoboam stayed in Jerusalem and built fortified cities throughout Judah.

verses.kjv: He built even Bethlehem, and Etam, and Tekoa,
verses.web: He built Bethlehem, Etam, Tekoa,
verses.ct: He fortified Bethlehem, Etam, Tekoa,

verses.kjv: And Bethzur, and Shoco, and Adullam,
verses.web: Beth Zur, Soco, Adullam,
verses.ct: Bethzur, Shoco, Adullam,

verses.kjv: And Gath, and Mareshah, and Ziph,
verses.web: Gath, Mareshah, Ziph,
verses.ct: Gath, Mareshah, Ziph,

verses.kjv: And Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,
verses.web: Adoraim, Lachish, Azekah,
verses.ct: Adoraim, Lachish, Azekah,

verses.kjv: And Zorah, and Aijalon, and Hebron, which are in Judah and in Benjamin fenced cities.
verses.web: Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron, which are fortified cities in Judah and in Benjamin.
verses.ct: Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron — all fortified cities in the territories of Judah and Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And he fortified the strong holds, and put captains in them, and store of victual, and of oil and wine.
verses.web: He fortified the strongholds, and put captains in them, and stores of food, oil and wine.
verses.ct: He strengthened these fortresses, placed commanders in each one, and stocked them with food, olive oil, and wine.

verses.kjv: And in every several city he put shields and spears, and made them exceeding strong, having Judah and Benjamin on his side.
verses.web: He put shields and spears in every city, and made them exceedingly strong. Judah and Benjamin belonged to him.
verses.ct: He also supplied every city with shields and spears, making them extremely well defended. So Judah and Benjamin remained under his control.

verses.kjv: And the priests and the Levites that were in all Israel resorted to him out of all their coasts.
verses.web: The priests and the Levites who were in all Israel stood with him out of all their territory.
verses.ct: The priests and Levites from all across Israel came and rallied to Rehoboam's side, leaving their territories behind.

verses.kjv: For the Levites left their suburbs and their possession, and came to Judah and Jerusalem: for Jeroboam and his sons had cast them off from executing the priest’s office unto the LORD:
verses.web: For the Levites left their pasture lands and their possession, and came to Judah and Jerusalem; for Jeroboam and his sons cast them off, that they should not execute the priest’s office to LORD.
verses.ct: The Levites abandoned their pasturelands and property and moved to Judah and Jerusalem, because Jeroboam and his sons had removed them from serving as priests of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he ordained him priests for the high places, and for the devils, and for the calves which he had made.
verses.web: He himself appointed priests for the high places, for the male goats, and for the calves which he had made.
verses.ct: Jeroboam had appointed his own priests to serve at the high places, to worship goat-demons, and to tend the calf-idols he had made.

verses.kjv: And after them out of all the tribes of Israel such as set their hearts to seek the LORD God of Israel came to Jerusalem, to sacrifice unto the LORD God of their fathers.
verses.web: After them, out of all the tribes of Israel, those who set their hearts to seek LORD, the God of Israel, came to Jerusalem to sacrifice to LORD, the God of their fathers.
verses.ct: Following the Levites, people from every tribe of Israel who were determined to seek the LORD God of Israel also came to Jerusalem to offer sacrifices to the LORD, the God of their ancestors.

verses.kjv: So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the son of Solomon strong, three years: for three years they walked in the way of David and Solomon.
verses.web: So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the son of Solomon strong for three years; for they walked three years in the way of David and Solomon.
verses.ct: They strengthened the kingdom of Judah and supported Rehoboam son of Solomon for 3 years, because during those 3 years the people followed the ways of David and Solomon.

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam took him Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David to wife, and Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse;
verses.web: Rehoboam took a wife for himself, Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David and of Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse.
verses.ct: Rehoboam married Mahalath, whose father was Jerimoth son of David, and whose mother was Abihail daughter of Eliab son of Jesse.

verses.kjv: Which bare him children; Jeush, and Shamariah, and Zaham.
verses.web: She bore him sons: Jeush, Shemariah, and Zaham.
verses.ct: She gave him sons: Jeush, Shamariah, and Zaham.

verses.kjv: And after her he took Maachah the daughter of Absalom; which bare him Abijah, and Attai, and Ziza, and Shelomith.
verses.web: After her, he took Maacah the daughter of Absalom; and she bore him Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.
verses.ct: After her, he married Maachah daughter of Absalom. She gave him Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam loved Maachah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines: (for he took eighteen wives, and threescore concubines; and begat twenty and eight sons, and threescore daughters.)
verses.web: Rehoboam loved Maacah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines; for he took eighteen wives and sixty concubines, and became the father of twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.
verses.ct: Rehoboam loved Maachah daughter of Absalom more than any of his other wives or concubines. In all, he had 18 wives and 60 concubines, and he fathered 28 sons and 60 daughters.

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam made Abijah the son of Maachah the chief, to be ruler among his brethren: for he thought to make him king.
verses.web: Rehoboam appointed Abijah the son of Maacah to be chief, the prince among his brothers; for he intended to make him king.
verses.ct: Rehoboam appointed Abijah, Maachah's son, as the leader among his brothers, because he intended to make him the next king.

verses.kjv: And he dealt wisely, and dispersed of all his children throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin, unto every fenced city: and he gave them victual in abundance. And he desired many wives.
verses.web: He dealt wisely, and dispersed of all his sons throughout all the lands of Judah and Benjamin, to every fortified city. He gave them food in abundance and he sought many wives for them.
verses.ct: Rehoboam acted wisely by spreading his sons throughout the territories of Judah and Benjamin, stationing them in every fortified city. He provided them with generous supplies and arranged many wives for them.
